titles.title: Providing for the acceptance of a statue of Chief Washakie, presented by the people of Wyoming, for placement in National Statuary Hall, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Thomas moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 333.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/27/2000--Passed House amended. Accepts the statue of Chief Washakie, furnished by the people of Wyoming for placement in National Statuary Hall, and thanks them.Authorizes Wyoming to use the rotunda of the Capitol on September 7, 2000, for a presentation ceremony for the statue.
